title: Brown Stock
ingredients: 2 pounds beef shanks, sawed into 1-inch sections
2 pounds veal shanks, sawed into 1-inch sections
a cheesecloth bag, containing, 4 sprigs of parsley, ½ teaspoon dried thyme, and 1 bay leave
instructions: Spread the beef shanks, the veal shanks, the onion, and the carrot in a flameproof baking pan, brown them well in a preheated 450° F. oven, and transfer them to a kettle.  Add 2 cups of water to the pan, deglaze the pan over high heat, scraping up the brown bits, and add the liquid to the kettle with and additional 14 cups of cold water, the celery, the salt, and the cheesecloth bag with the herbs.

Bring the water to a boil and skim the froth.  Add ½ cup cold water, bring the mixture to a simmer, and skim any froth.  Simmer the mixture, adding boiling water to keep the ingredients barely covered, for 5 to 6 hours, or until the stock is reduced to about 8 cups.
Strain the stock through a fine sieve into a bowl, pressing hard on the solids, and let it cool.  Chill the stock and remove the fat.
